enWisdom: Impudence is the symbol of evil

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْقِحَةَ فَإِنَّهَا تَحْدُوكَ عَلَى رُكُوبِ الْقَبَائِحِ وَالتَّهَجُّمِ عَلَى السَّيِّئَاتِ
enWisdom: Beware of impudence, for indeed it drives you to embark on ugly acts and to rush towards evil deeds
The worst countenance is [that of] the shameless
The cornerstone of every evil is impudence

Wisdom: شَرُّ الْأَشْرَارِ مَنْ لَا يَسْتَحْيِي مِنَ النَّاسِ وَلَا يَخَافُ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: The most evil of all is one who is not ashamed of [his actions in front of] the people and does not fear Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا حَيَاءَ لَهُ فَلَا خَيْرَ فِيهِ
enWisdom: Whoever has no modesty has no good in him
One whose modesty is reduced, his piety is [also] reduced

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ سَخَاءٌ وَلَا حَيَاءٌ [حِبَاءٌ] فَالْمَوْتُ خَيْرٌ لَهُ مِنَ الْحَيَاةِ
enWisdom: When there is neither generosity nor shame in a person, then death is better for him than life

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَسْتَحْيِ مِنَ النَّاسِ لَمْ يَسْتَحْيِ مِنَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: One who is not ashamed of the people will not feel ashamed in front of Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَتَّقِ وُجُوهَ الرِّجَالِ لَمْ يَتَّقِ اللَّهَ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: One who does not fear facing the people [after having been caught doing evil] does not fear Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: مَا أَبْعَدَ الصَّلَاحَ مِنْ ذِي الشَّرِّ الْوَقَاحِ
enWisdom: How far is probity from the people of evil and impudence!
The shamelessness of a man disgraces him
